title: BYD Seal

{{Use dmy dates|date=November 2022}} {{Short description|Chinese electric compact executive sedan}} {{Infobox electric vehicle | name = BYD Seal | image = BYD Seal image01.jpg | manufacturer = [[BYD Auto|BYD]] | aka = BYD Atto 4 | production = 2022–present | model_years = 2022–present | assembly = | class = [[Compact executive car|Compact executive]] ([[D-segment|D]]) | body_style = 4-door sedan | layout = {{unbulleted list | [[Rear-engine, rear-wheel-drive layout|Rear-motor rear-wheel-drive]] | [[Dual-motor, four-wheel-drive layout|Dual-motors all-wheel-drive]] }} | platform = e-platform 3.0 | motor = {{unbulleted list | {{convert|150|kW|PS hp|abbr=on|0}} (Standard range, RWD) | {{convert|230|kW|PS hp|abbr=on}} (Long range, RWD) | {{convert|390|kW|PS hp|abbr=on}} (Long Range AWD Performance) }} | range = 550km (342 mi)
700km (435 mi) | transmission = Single-speed Automatic | wheelbase = {{convert|2920|mm|in|1|abbr=on}} | length = {{convert|4800|mm|in|1|abbr=on}} | width = {{convert|1875|mm|in|1|abbr=on}} | height = {{convert|1460|mm|in|1|abbr=on}} | weight = 1885–2150 kg | battery = 61.4 – 82.5 kWh | energy consumption per 100 km = | related = | designer = | predecessor = | successor = }} The '''BYD Seal''' is a [[battery electric vehicle|battery electric]], [[compact executive car|compact executive]] [[sedan (automobile)#Fastback sedans|fastback sedan]] produced by [[BYD Auto]]. It is the second [[passenger car]] of BYD's latest "Ocean Series" of [[plug-in electric vehicle]]s,{{Cite web |date=20 February 2022 |title=BYD planning Model-3-like 800-volt sedan called Seal |url=https://www.electrive.com/2022/02/20/byd-planning-model-3-like-800-volt-sedan-called-seal/ |access-date=29 March 2022 |website=electrive.com |language=en-US}} after the smaller [[hatchback]] [[BYD Dolphin]]. In several overseas markets, the [[left hand drive]] variant of the BYD Seal is marketed as the '''BYD Atto 4'''.{{cite web|url=https://thedriven.io/2022/03/15/byd-seal-atto-4-electric-sportscar-to-rival-tesla-model-3-confirmed-for-australia/|title=BYD Seal electric sportscar to rival Tesla Model 3 confirmed for Australia|date=15 March 2022|last=Schmidt|first=Bridie|publisher=The Driven|accessdate=17 April 2022}} ==Overview== [[File:BYD Seal image02.jpg|thumb|left|BYD Seal rear]] The BYD Seal is built on the ''[[BYD Auto#e-Platform 3.0|e-Platform 3.0]]'', BYD's new 800-volt [[car platform]], while the design was unveiled as the BYD Ocean-X Concept in September 2021.{{Cite web |date=8 September 2021 |title=BYD LAUNCHES E-PLATFORM 3.0 WITH THE NEW CONCEPT CAR OCEAN-X|url=https://en.byd.com/news/byd-launches-e-platform-3-0-with-the-new-concept-car-ocean-x/|access-date=30 March 2022 |website=byd.com|language=en}} The Seal's top speed is limited to {{cvt|180|km/h}},{{Cite web |date=14 March 2022 |title=BYD Seal, Geometry E, and more announced NEVs from China – March 2022 (Part 1) |url=https://carnewschina.com/2022/03/14/byd-seal-geometry-e-and-more-announced-nevs-from-china-march-2022-part-1/ |access-date=29 March 2022 |website=CarNewsChina.com |language=en-US}} and the [[0 to 60 mph|0–100 kph]] acceleration is expected to be around 4 seconds. There are three models of [[powertrain]]s offered, with a {{cvt|150|kW|lk=on}} single-[[electric motor|motor]] [[rear wheel drive]], {{cvt|230|kW}} single-motor rear wheel drive, and a 160kW + 230kW dual-motor [[all wheel drive]] option. The car has [[vehicle-to-grid]] capability. The BYD Seal sedan claimed domestic [[all-electric range|driving range]] is between {{cvt|550|and|700|km}}.{{Cite web |date=7 September 2022 |title=When the BYD Atto 3 Standard Range, Seal, Dolphin will hit Australia|url=https://www.carexpert.com.au/car-news/when-the-byd-atto-3-standard-range-seal-dolphin-will-hit-australia|access-date=30 March 2022 |website=carexpert.com.au|language=en}} {{clear}} ==References== {{reflist}} {{BYD Auto}} {{BYD timeline 2003 to date}} [[Category:Cars introduced in 2022]] [[Category:Electric car models]] [[Category:BYD vehicles|Seal]] [[Category:Rear-wheel-drive vehicles]] [[Category:All-wheel-drive vehicles]] [[Category:Sports sedans]] [[Category:Production electric cars]] [[Category:Executive cars]] [[Category:Cars of China]] [[Category:2020s cars]] {{Modern-auto-stub}}
